name: Dark Sakura (Fate Stay Night)
description:
V2 Description

Since this is my first Lora ever made and (hopefully) I learned a lot since then I decided to make it again. It's all different training set so result is different too. I think this one is a lot better and in version description I'll list some pros and cons. Also all previews done with weight 1.0 except for closeup which is 0.8.

Basic prompt is now dark sakura, striped dress, hair ribbon.

The red marks now only needs body markings. You don't really have to add it if you're doing the dress unless you want to have a lot of it on legs. It's useful for other outfits through.

For best evil expression use parted lips, evil smile, empty eyes.

Gestures worth a try - hands on own face, hand on own chest, finger on mouth.

V1 Description

This is my first Lora and I'm still not sure what I'm doing but it seems to work fine with weight around 0.7.

Use dark sakura phrase to make it work and also long hair, black dress, red ribbon for the proper look. Adding red eyes and white hair should be unnecessary.

If you're making image with clothes different than original dress, using striped seems to add a stripe pattern similiar to the dress. Also red body markings usually appear with the dress, but for more revealing outfits you will have to use body markings, corruption if you want them to appear in any form other than on the side of the face.

modelVersions.name: V2
modelVersions.description:
Pros over V1:

  • MUCH more malicious expressions

  • Better quality in general, especially comparing on weight 1.0

  • More responsive to poses

  • Less tags needed for basic stuff

  • Trained on her most common gestures like hands on own face, hand on own chest, finger on mouth.

  • Better dress stripes.

Differences:

  • Hair feels longer by default

  • Needs lower weight on closeup because too much malice turns her into a horror.

Cons:

  • Will force dress design more, so you can for example get dress sleeves at other outfits. Requires some effort to go around.

  • Sometimes mouth gets too wide.
